analysis.Summary: Defines the client-side routing configuration for the "categories" section of the products module, including list, add, and edit category pages with their paths, metadata, and guards.
analysis.Purpose: To register and export an array of route definitions that the Vue router (or martyrs router) can use to navigate to and render category-related pages in the application.

Components.name: Categories.vue
Components.role: Renders the list of all product categories.

Components.name: CategoryEdit.vue
Components.role: Used for both adding a new category and editing an existing one.

Functions.name: component() => import(...)
Functions.description: Asynchronous loader function for code-splitting. Dynamically imports the corresponding Vue page component when the route is accessed.

Functions.name: validationAuth.requiresAuth
Functions.description: Navigation guard middleware that ensures the user is authenticated before entering the edit-category route.

Dependencies.reason: Uses validationAuth.requiresAuth as a beforeEnter guard

Dependencies.imported: via dynamic import in component loader
via dynamic import in component loader
Dependencies.reason: View component for adding or editing a category

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main router configuration (e.g. in `router/index.js` or equivalent) where the array is spread or concatenated into the global routes definition. Example: `import categoriesRoutes from './modules/products/router/categories.router.js';` then `routes.push(...categoriesRoutes)`.
Notes: The `beforeEnter` guard is only applied to the edit route, enforcing authentication.
All routes include localized titles in English and Russian under `meta.title` for use in page headers or breadcrumbs.
Dynamic imports enable lazy-loading of the category pages to optimize bundle size.
The `name` field in each route is unique and used for programmatic navigation.
